job_title: Graduate Assistant Baseball Coach in North Canton, OH
pros: Great atmosphere and environment. Great student athletes who excel in the classroom and on the field
cons: Pay is not the best. While there is other ways such as camps.

job_title: Director in North Canton, OH
pros: People are nice. Students are delightful.
cons: Institution is not willing to hear new ideas or care about data-driven results. They want what they've always had. The institution would like you to do more with less. They will not replace job positions. People left simply absorb responsibilities with no bump in pay.

job_title: Director Graduate Admissions in North Canton, OH
pros: Flexibility in schedule- comfortable and nice environment to work in. Great team of people.
cons: Cross departmental collaboration could be enhanced

job_title: Graduate Assistant in North Canton, OH
pros: Great people to work with
cons: some of the higher ups and policy decisions did not sit well with me.

job_title: Administrative in North Canton, OH
pros: Working with students to reach their goals
cons: The pay was pathetic considering what universities charge for tuition. The office politics were some of the worst I have experienced. There was a lot of talking behind backs and blatant disrespect from professors and department heads. They live in their own world. And I didn’t want to be a part of their childish behavior.

job_title: Administrative in North Canton, OH
pros: Close knit with immediate staff members
cons: Raises are very few and far between nowadays

job_title: Campus Tour Guide in North Canton, OH
pros: Consistent if you speak up. Your spots will be taken
cons: Lack of script, lack of proper training. Every tour is different.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Akron, OH
pros: Very friendly and helpful staff members.
cons: I have not experienced any cons.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in North Canton, OH
pros: benefits are okay and a lot of vacation time available.
cons: Lower end salary, not much room to climb

job_title: Student Services in North Canton, OH
pros: Nice coworkers for the mostpart
cons: A bit controlling on certain issues

job_title: Professor in North Canton, OH
pros: Students, legacy of the brothers
cons: Inexperienced administration that has no clue and is beholden to a president who has no clue what he is doing.

job_title: Maintenance Technician in North Canton, OH
pros: Paid days off of work
cons: Low pay for what you do

job_title: Graduate Student in Canton, OH
pros: Good education, connections, small campus
cons: I don't get paid, but 0 wasn't an option.

job_title: Online Course Developer in North Canton, OH
pros: The People, the students and the campus
cons: Can't get a full time job there - so no benes, but alot is expected of you.

review_title: Nice school and area. Somewhat low pay.
job_title: Admissions Counselor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Friendly co-workers and students. Walsh lives by their mission of developing leaders. North Canton is safe and affordable.
cons: Pay is not the greatest. This specific position can be overworked. Not much opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Member of Operational Staff in Vevey
pros: Everyone treats me very well
cons: There is no downside for working at Walsh

job_title: Admissions in Paris
pros: Free college for you and family members
cons: Favoritism, people are treated differently depending on if the manager likes you more or less

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Canton, OH
pros: By and large everyone works well together, across departments even, and there is almost a "family" feel that the administration pushes. Very friendly campus. Beautiful scenery. Autonomy in job position.  Collaborative. Very student friendly. Given lots of opportunities to do more than just typical work- including volunteer work and event programming
cons: Though the administration speaks on diversity quite a bit, it's as though they seem to think this is exclusive to race. I do not believe the campus has a race issue at all, in fact everyone is very welcoming, If anything more diversity awareness needs to be given in areas like religion and politics. One essentially needs to hide if he/she is an atheist.  Also it is very slow moving to try and get a promotion (if it happens at all). No raises given besides a 1% cost of living raise; nothing based on merit.

review_title: They do nothing to take care of their own.....
job_title: Work Study in Canton, OH
pros:
- Flexible scheduling.
- Seems like they're trying to install a lot of amenities.
- Campus is trying to grow and expand.
- Campus is usually well taken care of and manicured for the most part.
- Judeo-Christian education.
cons:
- Very limited opportunities to gain an internship if you're a student.
- Everything is overpriced. From the bookstore, the convenience stores, the tuition, and all the student fees. They love to rip off students.
- Faculty is underpaid.
- A lot of the department heads come off as snobby.
- Top Administrators (President, Provost, etc) are generally nowhere to be seen unless there are donors or news media nearby.
- Career Center is useless. No leads on any potential jobs for students at all.
- Parking is a nightmare.

review_title: Great job with excellent learning expierence
job_title: Accounting Intern in North Canton, OH
pros: I love working for Walsh University. As an intern I am able to have a very flexible schedule while learning about the finance department and the university as a whole.
cons: The only con that I have is that as an intern there is no opportunities currently for me to advance within Walsh. But they have been very supporting with my job hunting efforts.

review_title: A campus full of students with a sense of self-entitlement and very little support from faculty.
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in North Canton, OH
pros: The campus is nice. There are some students genuinely interested in learning and/or improving their skills.
cons: Department heads give no goals. Little/no student accountability. No support with students. I refused to continue beyond one semester.

job_title: Work Study- Campus Ministry in North Canton, OH
pros: I love my Work Study position here at Walsh University because it allows me to work directly with the Campus Ministry department on campus. The staff and managers are incredible, and there's lots of free food.
cons: The only con to this job is that you get very little hours. That comes with the territory of "work study," but come on, 6 hours a week?

job_title: Advancement Associate in North Canton, OH
pros: Very friendly and welcoming place to work. Able to work closely with many individuals. Have flexibility and my schedule and felt tremendous support.
cons: At times it's too small of a campus. Sort of like going back to high school.

job_title: Student Service Representative in Akron, OH
pros: They match your retirement savings very generously, the campus is beautiful and the holiday parties are fun. You can get tuition benefit after 30 days of employment unless your manager believes they are above the employee handbook and make you wait a year.
cons: Terrible management. HR is completely inaccessible, they pay diddly squat yet require even secretaries to have bachelor degrees. The President hires his friends and family members to make five figure salaries.

job_title: Work Study in North Canton, OH
pros: Had a great time with the staff participating in events. Very flexible with schedules.
cons: Not many disadvantages that I can think of.

job_title: Work Study Student in Canton, OH
pros: Flexible, Easy, No experience needed
cons: Pay is monthly and takes a while.

job_title: in Canton, OH
pros: Great folks to work for.
cons: No full time positions in sight.

job_title: in North Canton, OH
pros: The people are awesome
cons: It is a small campus
